t: The*pn wilderness and the wasteland shall be glad for them, And*ld the desert shall rejoice and blossom as the rose;

It*ld shall blossom abundantly and rejoice, Even*ld with joy and singing. The*ld glory of Lebanon shall be given to it, The*ld excellence of Carmel and Sharon. They*ld shall see the glory of the Lord,*s The*ld excellency of our God.
Strengthen*ln the weak hands, And*ld make firm the feeble knees.
Say*ld to those who*i are*i fearful-hearted, “Be*ld strong, do not fear! Behold,*ld your God will come with*i vengeance, With*ild the recompense of God; He*ld will come and save you.”
Then*ln the eyes of the blind shall be opened, And*ld the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
Then*ld the lame shall leap like a deer, And*ld the tongue of the dumb sing. For*ld waters shall burst forth in the wilderness, And*ld streams in the desert.
The*ld parched ground shall become a pool, And*ld the thirsty land springs of water; In*ld the habitation of jackals, where each lay, There*ild shall*i be*i grass with reeds and rushes.

A*ln highway shall be there, and a road, And*ld it shall be called the Highway of Holiness. The*ld unclean shall not pass over it, But*ld it shall*i be*i for others. Whoever*ld walks the road, although a fool, Shall*ld not go astray.
No*ld lion shall be there, Nor*ld shall any*i ravenous beast go up on it; It*ld shall not be found there. But*ld the redeemed shall walk there,*i

And*ld the ransomed of the Lord*s shall return, And*ld come to Zion with singing, With*ld everlasting joy on their heads. They*ld shall obtain joy and gladness, And*ld sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
